summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2021 between attorneys regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss identifying a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase and arranging for a subpoena.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney representing or advising JPMorgan Chase, coordinating with the prosecution to schedule meetings and discuss providing a trial witness and subpoena.

keyFacts: The correspondence is between attorneys in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) in late 2021.
The prosecution (AUSA Alison) is working with JPMorgan Chase's counsel (Allison Stoddart of WilmerHale) to identify a trial witness from the bank and to provide a subpoena.
Jury selection for the Maxwell trial was underway in November 2021, complicating scheduling for the legal teams.
The emails show coordination for meetings involving an individual named Pat McHugh.
The document reveals procedural steps in trial preparation, specifically the procurement of a witness from a financial institution.
